Function Documentation

nitf_BandInfo* nitf_BandInfo_construct (  nitf_Error *  error  ) 
 

Constructor for a BandInfo object. All internal values are constructed to size, with the default fill. The lookup table is set to NULL to start.

Parameters:
error An error to populate on a NULL return
Returns:
The newly allocated bandInfo object, or NULL upon failure

void nitf_BandInfo_destruct (  nitf_BandInfo **  info  ) 
 

Destruct all sub-objects, and make sure that we kill this object too.

Parameters:
info The BandInfo to destroy. We point info at NULL.

NITF_BOOL nitf_BandInfo_init (  nitf_BandInfo *  bandInfo,
char *  representation,
char *  subcategory,
char *  imageFilterCondition,
char *  imageFilterCode,
nitf_Uint32  numLUTs,
nitf_Uint32  bandEntriesPerLUT,
nitf_LookupTable *  lut,
nitf_Error *  error
) 
 

nitf_BandInfo_init - Initialize a band info object

nitf_BandInfo_init initialize a band info table object. The caller must ( supply an existing object, this function does not construct one.

Any of the string arguments can be NULL in which case the default value is used.

The object retains a refference to the lut argument, it does not make a copy

Returns:
FALSE is returned on error and the supplied error object is set
Parameters:
bandInfo  The band info to initialize
representation  The band representation
subcategory  The band subcategory
imageFilterCondition  The band filter condition
imageFilterCode  The band standard image filter code
numLUTs  The number of look-up tables
bandEntriesPerLUT  The number of entries/LUT
lut  The look-upt tables
error  Error object for error returns

NITFPROT (  nitf_BandInfo *   ) 
 

Clone this object. This is a deep copy operation. The lut is set to NULL if the source has none, and otherwise, is a deep copy of the LUT (clone).

Parameters:
source The source object
error An error to populate upon failure
Returns:
A new object that is identical to the old
